posts.post_content: Would have made more sense in Bant colors, but whatever. The fact that it gives shroud is decent, considering without it land bounce or destruction results in a two-for-one. However, [Fertile Ground](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fertile Ground) is a bit easier to manage color-wise, and land bounce/destruction isn't all that common.

posts.post_content: These colors giving shroud is kinda odd, and it's not the only card in the set to do this, as the [Naya Hushblade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Naya Hushblade) also gets shroud. I think the shroud is more of a white and green function, however, as there have been white and green cards in the past that have done this, such as Ravnica's green and white hybrid, [Privileged Position](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Privileged Position), Time Spiral's green [Aspect of Mongoose](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Aspect of Mongoose), and Shadowmoor's white [Greater Auramancy](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Greater Auramancy). However, in terms of how well this card is, I personally don't care for it. The shroud seems to do more harm than good, as there isn't too much land destruction going around in everyday play, and there also aren't too many things that can actually target lands at all. The few things that do target lands can tap or untap them, and if I happen to be running one of those items in a deck, it makes sense to untap an enchanted land to get more mana. [Fertile Ground](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fertile Ground) is, in my opin... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: djpraiseadelik (9/5/2009 5:02:24 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I would mix this card with fertile ground. I don't know why everyone mentions shroud, theres some creature with shroud in every color, its not really a flavor oriented ability. The reason for the shroud on the enchantment is because mtg staff mentioned they wanted to fix the tempo you can lose by enchanting something that gets bounced or destroyed because its 1 card for 2. So they started giving enchantments either better benefits, or ways to keep them in play. Personally I like the shroud, as there are several ways to destroy the land or get rid of an enchantment.
  
   
Boomerang, creeping mold, thresher beast, and deus of calamity all come to mind.
posts.html:

So they started giving enchantments either better benefits, or ways to keep them in play. Personally I like the shroud, as there are several ways to destroy the land or get rid of an enchantment.

Boomerang, creeping mold, thresher beast, and deus of calamity all come to mind.
